intro: [WRONG START] Mespilus vulgarus, commonly known as the common white mulberry, is a deciduous tree native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Moraceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, white flowers that appear in early spring. The tree produces edible, fuzzy fruits that ripen in late summer, often used in jams and desserts. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its fruit. The bark and leaves have also been used in traditional medicine for their medicinal properties.
